alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued May 07 at 3:09AM MDT until May 08 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 8 PM SUNDAY FOR PORTIONS OF NORTHERN AND EASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Another round of strong southwest winds, low humidity, seasonably warm temperatures, and an unstable airmass is expected this afternoon. This will lead to critical fire weather conditions below snowpack, primarily over the eastern half of New Mexico. Except for the Northeast Highlands, critical conditions are forecast to mostly retreat and decrease on Monday due to lighter winds, however the threat could return over portions of eastern New Mexico Tuesday and then become widespread by Wednesday. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Monday afternoon through Monday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Plains (104) from 11 am to 8 pm MDT today, then again Monday afternoon through Monday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 mph with winds speeds peaking in the mid to late afternoon hours. On Monday, southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts to near 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...6 to 12 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning and Fire Weather Watch.
